file_insights.changes: Updated project state tracking - incremented completed subtasks from 11 to 17, changed current phase to 'Responsive Typography System', updated session number from 12 to 18, and refreshed timestamp
Added new responsiveFontSize object with mobile-first breakpoints (xs, sm, md) for typography levels (display, h1-h4, body, small), providing pixel-equivalent comments for clarity

Refactored all typography definitions to use responsive tokens with media queries at 600px and 900px breakpoints; added global CSS rules for overflow handling, word wrapping, and hyphenation across heading and text elements; improved RTL support

patterns_discovered.name: Mobile-First Breakpoint Strategy
patterns_discovered.description: Font sizes scale from xs (mobile) → sm (600px) → md (900px), establishing responsive hierarchy without mobile adjustments
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Each typography level has explicit px equivalents in comments (e.g., xs: '1.75rem' = 28px)

patterns_discovered.name: Systematic Typography Scaling
patterns_discovered.description: Consistent proportional scaling across all heading levels (h1-h6), body text, and small text with intentional sizing hierarchy
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Display (2rem→2.5rem→3rem), H1 (1.75rem→2rem→2.25rem), H2 (1.5rem→1.625rem→1.75rem) showing gradual increments

patterns_discovered.name: Global Text Overflow Mitigation
patterns_discovered.description: Comprehensive CSS reset for text handling across headings and paragraphs to prevent layout breaking on small screens
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Applied overflowWrap, wordWrap, hyphens: auto, and maxWidth: 100% to multiple selectors

patterns_discovered.name: Declarative Media Query Pattern
patterns_discovered.description: Inline media queries within typography variant definitions rather than separate breakpoint files
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: @media queries nested in h1-h6, body1-body2, button definitions

gotchas_discovered.description: h5, h6, body2, and button only define xs and sm breakpoints, missing md (900px+) breakpoint unlike h1-h4
gotchas_discovered.impact: Typography scaling stops at 600px for smaller text elements, potentially causing unexpected size jumps on larger screens
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Add md breakpoints to all typography variants for complete responsive coverage

gotchas_discovered.description: Responsive font size values are hard-coded in theme.ts media queries rather than referenced from tokens.ts breakpoint values
gotchas_discovered.impact: Potential maintenance burden if breakpoints need adjustment - changes required in two locations
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Consider exporting breakpoint constants (600px, 900px) from tokens.ts and importing them in theme.ts

gotchas_discovered.description: responsiveFontSize includes a 'display' level (2rem→2.5rem→3rem) in tokens but it's not used in the theme typography definitions
gotchas_discovered.impact: Defined but unused token creates confusion about typography scale hierarchy
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Either use the display variant for a new h1-equivalent or remove it from tokens if not needed

gotchas_discovered.description: Body text uses xs: 0.938rem (15px) on mobile instead of larger size, with comment indicating conscious choice for readability
gotchas_discovered.impact: Smaller-than-default mobile text may reduce accessibility for users with vision impairments on small screens
gotchas_discovered.recommendation: Validate against WCAG font size guidelines and user testing on actual mobile devices

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully implemented responsive typography system with mobile-first approach, establishing scalable token architecture and media query patterns
key_achievements: Created responsiveFontSize token structure supporting xs/sm/md breakpoints
Refactored all 9 typography variants (h1-h6, body1-body2, button, caption) to use responsive tokens
Added global CSS rules for text overflow handling and word wrapping
Implemented media queries at 600px and 900px breakpoints
Progress milestone: completed 17/22 subtasks, advanced phase from 'Component Responsive Updates' to 'Responsive Typography System'
deliverables_provided: responsive typography tokens with pixel equivalents
media query implementations for heading and body variants
global CSS reset for text rendering consistency

recommendations.action: Add md breakpoint (900px+) to h5, h6, body2, and button typography variants to ensure consistent responsive coverage
recommendations.rationale: Current implementation leaves 4 typography variants without scaling rules for medium+ screens, creating inconsistent behavior

recommendations.action: Validate typography rendering across actual device breakpoints (375px, 768px, 1024px) to ensure visual balance
recommendations.rationale: Mobile-first responsive typography requires empirical validation that scaling produces readable, well-proportioned text

recommendations.action: Extract breakpoint values (600px, 900px) as constants in tokens.ts to eliminate duplication and enable single-source updates
recommendations.rationale: Currently hardcoded in theme.ts media queries; centralized constants improve maintainability and reduce error surface

recommendations.action: Clarify or remove unused 'display' typography variant from responsiveFontSize tokens if not intended for future use
recommendations.rationale: Defined but unused tokens create ambiguity about intended typography scale and may confuse future developers

recommendations.action: Review mobile body text size (15px/0.938rem) against WCAG guidelines and conduct user testing with vision-impaired users
recommendations.rationale: 15px is at lower end of recommended range; ensure it doesn't negatively impact readability on small screens

recommendations.action: Document the responsive typography scale rationale and breakpoint selection in code comments or design system docs
recommendations.rationale: Current pixel comments are helpful; adding context about why these specific sizes/breakpoints were chosen aids future maintenance
